modules.name: additional_course_data_analytics_methods
modules.additionalPrerequisite: The prerequisites are determined by the credited course

modules.name: statistics_for_data_scientists
recommendedLiterature: Cameron, C.A. and P.K. Trivedi. 1998. Regression Analysis of Count Data. Cambridge: Cambridge University Press.
Greene, W.H. (2008). Econometric Analysis. 6th ed. Upper Saddle River: Prentice Hall.
Long, J.S. (1997). Regression Models for Categorical and Limited Dependent Variables. Thousand Oaks: Sage.
Verbeek, M. 2017. A Guide to Modern Econometrics. 5th ed. Chichester: Wiley.
Wooldridge, J.M. 2002. Econometric Analysis of Cross Section and Panel Data. Cambridge, MA: MIT Press.
Imbens, Guido W., and Donald B. Rubin. Causal Inference for Statistics, Social, and Biomedical Sciences: An Introduction. Cambridge: Cambridge University Press, 2015.
Angrist, Joshua D., and Jorn-Steffen Pischke. Mostly Harmful Econometrics: An Empiricist's Companion. Princeton: Princeton University Press, 2009.

hasLecturer.name: Lecturer of the School of Social Sciences, I.e chair of Social Data Science

hasPersonInCharge.name: Lecturer of the School of Social Sciences, I.e. Chair of social Data Science

modules.additionalPrerequisite: A sound understanding of the linear regression model (OLS) is required. Knowledge in linear algebra and calculus is useful.

modules.name: seminar_and_lab_on_machine_learning_and_causal_inference
recommendedLiterature: Downey, Allen B. 2016. Think Python. How to Think Like a Computer Scientist. 2nd ed. Needham: Green Tea Press.
Guttag, John V. 2021. Introduction to Computation and Programming Using Python. 3rd. ed. Cambridge: MIT Press.
The Python Tutorial (online: https://docs.python.org/3/tutorial/)

hasLecturer.name: Lecturer of the School of Social Sciences, I.e. chair of social data science

hasPersonInCharge.name: Lecturer of the School of Social Sciences, I.e. chair of social data science

optionalPrerequisiteModules: Python or any other object-programming language

modules.name: decision_support
recommendedLiterature: S. Russel and P. Norvig: AI a modern Approach (3rd Edition), 2010 (selected sections)
modules.additionalPrerequisite: Basic Probability Theory, Basic Knowledge of Propositional and First-Order Logic

modules.name: web_mining
recommendedLiterature: Bing Liu: Web Data Mining. 2nd Edition, Springer, 2011.
Wouter de Nooy, et al.: Exploratory Social Network Analysis with Pajek. 2nd Edition, Cambridge University Press, 2011.
Bing Liu. Sentiment Analysis and Opinion Mining, Morgan & Claypool Publishers, 2012.
modules.additionalPrerequisite: Fundamental notions of linear algebra and probability theory

modules.name: deep_learning
recommendedLiterature: I. Drori. The Science of Deep Learning. Cambridge University Press, 2023.
I. Goodfellow, Y. Bengio, A. Courville. Deep Learning, The MIT Press, 2017.
K.P. Murphy. Probabilistic Machine Learning: An Introduction. The MIT Press, 2022.
K.P. Murphy. Probabilistic Machine Learning: Advanced Topics. The MIT Press, 2023.
modules.additionalPrerequisite: no attempted or completed IE 674 exam

modules.name: web_mining_project
recommendedLiterature: Bing Liu: Web Data Mining. 2nd Edition, Springer, 2011.
Wouter de Nooy, et al.: Exploratory Social Network Analysis with Pajek. 2nd Edition, Cambridge University Press, 2011.
Bing Liu. Sentiment Analysis and Opinion Mining, Morgan & Claypool Publishers, 2012.
modules.additionalPrerequisite: Programming skills in Java or Python

modules.name: large_language_models_and_agents
recommendedLiterature: Zhou et al.: A Comprehensive Survey on Pretrained Foundation Models: A History from BERT to ChatGPT. 2023.
Zhao et al.: A Survey of Large Language Models. 2024.
Wang et al.: A Survey on Large Language Model based Autonomous Agents. 2024.
modules.additionalPrerequisite: Programming skills in Python; Basic machine learning concepts and techniques

modules.name: advanced_process_mining
recommendedLiterature: Wil van der Aalst: Process Mining: Data Science in Action, 2nd edition (Recommended)
Josep Carmona et al. Conformance checking, 1st edition (Recommended)
modules.additionalPrerequisite: You are expected to be familiar with the use of Petri nets and BPMN for process modeling, and being able to do basic programming in Python.

modules.name: advanced_methods_in_text_analytics
recommendedLiterature: Dan Jurafsky and James H. Martin, Speech and Language Processing: An Introduction to Natural Language Processing, Computational Linguistics, and Speech Recognition (3rd edition)

modules.name: higher_level_computer_vision
recommendedLiterature: Goodfellow et al.: Deep Learning, MIT Press, 2016.
R. Szeliski: Computer Vision Algorithms and Applications, Springer, 2010.
D. Forsyth, J. Ponce: Computer Vision: A Modern Approach, Prentice Hall, 2nd edition, 2012.
R. Hartley, A. Zisserman: Multiple View Geometry in Computer Vision, Cambridge University Press, 2nd edition, 2004.
modules.additionalPrerequisite: Basis skills in linear algebra, basis knowledge in python and pytorch

modules.name: image_processing
recommendedLiterature: R. Szeliski: Computer Vision Algorithms and Applications, Springer, 2010.
D. Forsyth, J. Ponce: Computer Vision: A Modern Approach, Prentice Hall, 2nd edition, 2012.
modules.additionalPrerequisite: Basis skills in linear algebra, basis knowledge in python

modules.name: generative_computer_vision_models
recommendedLiterature: Ian Goodfellow and Yoshua Bengio and Aaron Courville, Deep Learning, An MIT press book, 2016.

modules.name: machine_learning_and_causal_inference
recommendedLiterature: Angrist, Joshua D., and Jörn-Steffen Pischke. 2009. Mostly Harmless Econometrics: An Empiricist’s Companion.
Murphy, Kevin P. 2012. Machine Learning: A Probabilistic Perspective.
Hastie, Trevor, Robert Tibshirani, and Jerome Friedman. 2008. The Elements of Statistical Learning.
Imbens, Guido W., and Donald B. Rubin. 2015. Causal Inference for Statistics, Social, and Biomedical Sciences: An Introduction.
Morgan, Stephen L., and Christopher Winship. 2007. Counterfactuals and Causal Inference.

hasLecturer.name: Lecturer of the School of Social Sciences, I.e. Chair of Social Data Science

hasPersonInCharge.name: Lecturer of the School of Social Sciences, I.e. Chair of Social Data Science

modules.additionalPrerequisite: A sound understanding of basic statistical methods incl. regression analysis
